content:
With the contentEditable attribute a div turns into a simple edit box. It makes it easier to customize but will need more to actually submit data with it. In order to make use of it it requires having a contentEditable attribute inside a div set to true. 

For example: 

Blue editable div. ------click to edit-------

Below is a link to an example code.

https://gist.github.com/wilfriedE/5957659
title: Editable divs

content:
Let's say you have a variable you want to switch from true to false on ocasion.Below is a small description or how this may be applied using a method.

This may be applied in the case where a user is admin and you want to toggle back to non admin

e.i user.admin = !user.admin
title: Toggle.rb (Toggle in Ruby)
